definitions.definition: A graduated , circular scale over which a needle moves to show a measurement (such as speed ).
examples: The dial on the dashboard showed the car was nearly out of gas.

subdefinitions.definition: Such a field as part of a clock face ; ( metonymic ) the entire clock face.

definitions.definition: A panel on a radio etc showing wavelengths or channels ; a knob that is turned to change the wavelength etc.
examples: Turn the dial to Radio 4: my favourite show is on!

definitions.definition: A disk with finger holes on a telephone ; used to select the number to be called .
examples: His hands were too fat to operate the dial on the telephone.

main_definition: A graduated , circular scale over which a needle moves to show a measurement (such as speed ).
secondary_definitions: A panel on a radio etc showing wavelengths or channels ; a knob that is turned to change the wavelength etc.
A disk with finger holes on a telephone ; used to select the number to be called .
( UK , Australia , slang ) A person's face . [from 19th c.]
